channel.title: How to decode .class
channel.description: Ok Guys if you ever heard of a server called jag3x you might of loved it as much as me. I want to bring it back so i still have its client from 2009 and i just need some help decoding a .class file EGUI. Its all i need to decode, so i can change the IP of the client. thanks so all i need is to know how to decode a .class to a .java

item.title: How to decode .class
item.dc:creator: @kill_you704 kill you704
item.description:
@kill_you704 wrote:

send to my email or something please?

item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

I could link you up with a crack file for DJ Java, but I don’t think posting it publicly would be good for my account’s health. (could get banned etc.)

Read full topic

item.title: How to decode .class
item.dc:creator: @laurent_248 laurent 248
item.description:
@laurent_248 wrote:

This is the best one I found, http://java.decompiler.free.fr/?q=jdgui it decompiles an entire class and can export the .java files in a rar. copy/paste=not needed!

Get jode for less errors. http://jode.sourceforge.net/download.php

Enjoy!

Read full topic

item.title: How to decode .class
item.dc:creator: @Killerswan Killerswan
item.description:
@Killerswan wrote:

DJ is a nice .class decompiler but they like to charge $$$

even if you decompile, the .class is STILL going to be different than the original .java file… they won’t be the same as the .class will still use class variables… Such as things like s1 can be turned into args[1] and what not…

Read full topic

item.title: How to decode .class
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

You have to download a Java Decompiler such as DJJavaDecompiler.

Read full topic
